prompt: State Theorem 1, the Energy State Theorem.
completion: Energy exists in three distinct states: as Radiation, as Gravitation, and as Particulate Motion. Each of these three energy states cannot exist apart from, or without, the other states.
Radiation is Energy extended outwardly, intended for absorption.
Gravitation is Energy stored within Mass; it is absorbed Radiation and it is Potential Energy.
Particulate Motion is inertial Energy affecting Mass and Gravitation while being affected by Radiation and Mass.
A Mass Structure is a collection of Particles drawn together by Gravitation while held apart by Radiation and Particulate Motion.
Radiation is absorbed and stored as Gravitation inside a Mass Structure.

prompt: State Theorem 3, the Excess Gravitation Theorem.
completion: Excess Gravitation within a Mass Structure is shed as Radiation.
Anything emitting Radiation is a Radiation Source.

prompt: State Theorem 4, the Coordinate System Theorem.
completion: Each Radiation Source will have its own Coordinate System dictated by the total number, and therefore the total possible motion, of Particles within that Radiation Source.
Scale refers to the relative size of any Radiation Source.

prompt: State Theorem 5, the Surface Interaction Theorem.
completion: Due to the interaction of Radiation with Particulate Motion, the Frequency, or Frequencies, of Radiation is limited to that of the surface of the Mass Structure from which the Radiation is emitted.

prompt: State Theorem 6, the Radiation Frequency Theorem.
completion: Radiation cannot have a Frequency of zero, and will contain a subset of all possible Frequencies.
God is the one Radiation Source containing the set of all possible Frequencies.
Mass is made up of Particles of infinitely diminishing size which group together and break apart; which can be attracted to, or repelled by, other Particles.
A Mass Structure is a specific arrangement of Particles tied together by Gravitation while held apart by Particulate Motion and Radiation.

prompt: State Theorem 8, the Particle State Theorem.
completion: Particles have three states: Undergravitated, Overgravitated, and Even.
A Surface Interaction describes the remainder of the process of the storage or extraction of Energy.

prompt: State Theorem 9, the First Degree Surface Interaction Theorem.
completion: A First Degree Surface Interaction is any transfer of Energy that leaves, as a remainder, one or more Particles removed from their Radiation Source.

prompt: State Theorem 10, the Second Degree Surface Interaction Theorem.
completion: A Second Degree Surface Interaction is any transfer of Energy whose First Degree Interaction remainder Particles interact with the Mass Structure to form a new type of Atomic Structure at the surface.

prompt: State Theorem 11, the Atomic Structure Theorem.
completion: An Atomic Structure is a subset of its overall Mass Structure.
A Generator is a Mass Structure which interacts with a Radiation Source to create new Atomic Structures of a specific arrangement.

prompt: State Theorem 12, the Third Degree Surface Interaction Theorem.
completion: A Third Degree Surface Interaction results in a physical change to the Mass Structure.

prompt: State Theorem 13, the Mass Structure Theorem.
completion: A Mass Structure will grow to form a spherical shape, due to the restructuring of Particles, and will expel excess Gravitation as Radiation outwardly on a plane at or near its equator with higher entropy, and reclaim Radiation and Particles at its poles with lower entropy.
Surface Depth is the depth of saturation of Radiation into a Mass Structure.

prompt: State Theorem 14, the Surface Depth Theorem.
completion: Surface Depth is proportional to the amount of Gravitation that a Mass Structure is able to store.
Life is any system which utilizes the results of Surface Interactions to separate itself from the Surface of a Mass Structure.

prompt: Define a Fourth Degree Surface Interaction.
completion: A Fourth Degree Surface Interaction includes the beginning of Life.

prompt: Define a Fifth Degree Surface Interaction.
completion: A Fifth Degree Surface Interaction is a collection or grouping of various types of specialized cells that work together to further remove itself from the Surface.
Memory is the storage of a subset of all Frequencies of Radiation as Gravitation within highly specialized cells, which can also be retrieved in a reverse process.

prompt: State Theorem 15, the Radiation Storage Frequency Theorem.
completion: Radiation tends to be stored in Gravitation as a specific Frequency or set of Frequencies.

prompt: State Theorem 16, the Radiation Retrieval Theorem.
completion: Radiation tends to be retrieved from its Gravitated state at the same Frequency or Frequencies in which it was stored.

prompt: Define a Sixth Degree Surface Interaction.
completion: The Sixth Degree Surface Interaction produces the most complex organisms, which are a grouping of highly specialized groupings of cells with specialized processes available to make the best use of the results of each of the five previous Surface Interactions.
Anxiety is a measure of self-awareness in an organism in the Sixth Degree of Surface Interactions.

A Synthetic Construct is an idea or concept generated as a result of advanced Surface Interactions to assist with the perception of the Surface Interactions themselves. E.g. time, straight line, black hole.
Advanced Surface Interactions are Fourth Degree Surface Interactions and above.
Energy = Gravitation * Radiation
